text: a wood employee tested positive for covid 19   a wood employee tested positive for covid 19. ee has mild symptoms and will home quarantine. contact tracing has been conducted - ee was not around any employees.  ee instructed to home quarantine.

category: head or face injury, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: during the maneuvering operations a road cart, a tire struck against a piezometric coloumn. during the maneuvering operations a multi-axle modular trailer, used for the transport of the f101 oven radiant modules, a tire struck against a piezometric column of the refinery's freatimetric and hydro chemical system. the impact broke the external protection and of a few centimeters of the head of the internal 4 "piezometric tube, as well as a vertical split of about 50 centimeters, from the ground level, along the stretch blind. additional signs put on site and integration of the existent protection.further maneuvers near the piezometer will be carried out with the aid of a second control maneuver, also optimizing the communication between the various subjects involved in the operations.

category: foot or leg injury, head or face injury
text: ip suffered a slight graze to the back of his head migrated from legacy cairs incident #30399incidentaround 12:00pm when walking to the crib room to have lunch the ip was walking up the stairs when he felt his body start to fall when his left ankle rolled from under him, this happens at intervals due to his current condition and the lack of having feeling in his left side, when he started feeling himself fall he was able to step down the stairs towards the ground and continue falling and rolling in a controlled way to the ground, when the ip rolled his head hit a small stone grazing the back of his headother observationsthe ip explained that he was not holding the handrail when climbing the stairs and at the time his hands were emptyhis boot was not tied up tight around his ankle this reduced the support migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

employees leg made contact with small spool causing first aid injury. the wire grounding crew was scheduled to ground at block 4. the crew started by cutting the ground cable at the main laydown yard near the electrical tool room. after cutting the ground cable the crew proceeded to move the ground cable reel to its proper storage. at about 8:00am the crew started to roll the ground cable reel with a pipe placed through the spool. when the employee attempted to turn the spool in the desired location the employees left shin made contact with the edge of the pipe and right knee made contact with spool.  employee was evaluated by the site medic and released to work. incident is under further investigation and rca will be submitted for corrective/preventative measures.

nine (9) weber employees tested positive to covid-19 nine (9) weber employees tested positive to covid-19. the workers no longer present on site since 21rt april due to possible contact with other employees sick to covid-19. pcr tests, today, confirmed their positivity to disease. employees positive to covid-19 continue their quarantine.

category: foot or leg injury, hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: ip states at approximately 1340hrs was out on m03 main deck starboard with group of six other coworkers preparing to pull instrument cable for hp system. ip stepped over piping and lost footing and fell forward and partially caught fall with left arm migrated from legacy cairs incident #29056ip states at approximately 1340hrs was out on m03 main deck starboard with group of six other coworkers preparing to pull instrument cable for hp system. ip stepped over piping and lost footing and fell forward and partially caught fall with left arm and felt tear to left upper arm. ip was able to get up after fall without assistance and felt no apparent injury. ip reports when attempted to continue work and use left arm felt weakness and cramping to left upper arm. ip stopped work and reported incident to supervisor and now reports to health center for assessment. treatment provided for left arm injury and abrasion to right lower leg. ip off work. plan for casevac onshore in am for further evaluation /treatment. rtc in am prior to casevac and as needed any further issues or concerns. supervisor notified. *medical evaluation is ongoing and severity of the incident may change. 31st march 2016 update ip was seen by aoms (medical provider)and cleared to return to work with restrictions (no lifting, climbing ladders or use of left arm note ip is right handed). ip appears to be well with the obvious arm limitations. it is thought to be a bicep tendon but ip has a specialist appointment on april 5th. once ip has had this appointment ip will return to aoms for assessment and definition of the treatment plan. ip is currently on 3 week field break and is not due to return offshore until april 13th. on the assumptions that the restrictions remain in place ip will be on modified duties and we with the employer will assess and accommodate as we can. this of course will be dependent on the outcome of his specialist appointment. cairs entry updated to a rwc with 0 days restricted as he was due to demob onshore while ip was held by weather offshore. also please note that whilst this is a rwc it has the potential to become an lti should the ip require surgical intervention and that takes place during ip’s 3 week working rotation, again we with the employer will assess post his appointment with the specialist. update 8th april. ip has had mri and seen specialist and is undergoing surgery 12th april. aoms will review and assess on 14th april. this case is now classed as lost time as ip will not be available for work on 13th aprilupdate 18th april ip had successful surgery on 13th april. ip was assessed by aoms 15th april and is cleared for restricted work.ip is an offshore employee on a 3 week on 3 week off rotation. his current rotation would have started on 13th april. ip cleared ot return to work offshore on full duties 15th august migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: foot or leg injury, hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: ip fell down a step entering the gym at a hotel, whilst travelling on company business. during a stay at the hilton double tree in bristol whilst away on business, ip did not notice a poorly marked step in their fitness centre and tumbled down the step. ip fell on their face and ended up with a thick lip, hurt their left foot, right knee (knee cap) and left hand.  the left hand and foot are still quite painful. the step fallen down was located just inside the entrance to the gym, and was approximately 2 to 3 inches high, with grey carpet. hazard tape had been placed on the step which was very worn, and so not very visible.  reported to hotel, saw their first aider, and signed the hotel site accident book.called an amecfw colleague and asked them to raise a heart call 201710893.

category: lifting or moving loads, line strike
text: a crane operators initial travel path could not be used due to vehicle traffic & an alternate route was chosen. the operator completed the work, took the same path to exit the area & contacted an overhead ground cable, breaking the cable. migrated from legacy cairs incident #34678on wednesday, september 27, 2017 at 2:20 pm at the phillips 66 jones creek terminal an infinity construction crane operator was being escorted by a spotter from job trailer area to the construction area to place shoring in an excavation. the intended travel path to the work location was blocked by other contractors vehicles and a pump truck. due to this interference, the operator and spotter took a different route around the control room. the operator made it to work location and performed placement of shoring in excavation. after completing the work the crane backed up from work location and made a right hand turn and went to travel back to job trailer using the same travel path they took to the work location. the spotter was placed in front of the crane, they drove approximately 20' and the boom of crane contacted a ground cable that was overhead between power poles. the ground cable is not energized. the energized power lines were approximately 8-10 feet higher on pole and were not contacted. once the ground cable was struck, it broke the ground cable. other employees in the area noticed the crane contacted the line and hollered to stop the operator. all work was stopped and the investigation was started. the operator and the spotter were taken for post incident drugs screens. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description
confirmed positive for covid-19 employee received positive covid-19 test results. no other wood employees in close contact.

category: non-work related injury or illness, foot or leg injury, head or face injury, slips & trips
text: location:  movenpick hotel, al khobar, saudi arabiaemployee slipped and fell while walking from the bathroom.employee sustained a non- work related injury. migrated from legacy cairs incident #31913below is the excerpt from an email from billschock:i've had an interesting night. i slippedcoming out of the hotel room bathroom and fell hitting my head on the floor. the blow split the skin on my forehead above my left eye. i stopped the bleeding with a towel and called the hotel desk for help. they sent someone up and decided to escort me to the nearby hospital. i received eleven stitches (i think), a tetanus shot, and a prescription for antibiotics. hotel paid for all so far. i am sore but ok.the hotel room entry and bathroom floors have very smooth granite tile - no carpet or rugs. the bath is right off the entry and leaving the bath, you make a left turn to go to the rest of the room. i must have spilled some water in the entry just outside the bathroom. i was barefoot and headed back to bed when i came out of the bathroom, turned,and slipped on the water. the floor was so slick, i fell immediately and did not get my arms out to brace the fall. instead i landed on my side and head.date: 13dec2018approximate time: 01:00amlocation: movenpick hotel, al khobar, saudi arabianame: bill schockaccident: fallinjury: stitches, bump, and soreness migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: general injury, hand or arm injury
text: ip's arm caught on broken light tube causing a laceration. a broken tube light bulb had been left in a bucket outside.  the bucket is normally used for disinfecting ecology equipment.  i was filling up another bucket next to the one with the broken light bulb using a hose pipe.  i moved my arm and caught the edge of the broken bulb which pierced the skin, leaving a cut on my left forearm. ip went to reception to use the first aid kit and used an antiseptic wipe, but there were not plasters large enough to cover the wound so i was given one by a member of staff who had her own personal supply.

category: foot or leg injury, back injury, general injury, vehicle incident general
text: while carrying fence panel, ip felt strain in back. ip reports  carrying a fence panel that weighed approximately 50 lbs. and was 6' x 8'. ip reports body shifted awkwardly and felt a pain in the left side of the upper back and rib area. injuries to muscles, tendons, ligaments, joints, etc. (inc. dislocations). work care contacted.

visitor fell on temporary walkway a visitor from cementation skanska, slipped and fell on the temporary pedestrian walkway currently in place at red barnes way due to improvement works on the car park. the incident happened on his way into the yard. the visitor reported the incident at reception.   the visitor reported the incident at reception and was offered first aid, but declined. he was offered first aid again when facilities manager, came to check on him but again declined.

the wood employee was under monitoring at home when was tested as a positive during pre embark quarantine the wood employee was under monitoring at home when was tested as a positive during pre embark quarantine. no symptoms were related during this period. isolation

ip with shoulder pain (nwr) hse focal point informed by slfp of an ip with shoulder aggravation on 10/07/16, on discussion with slfp/medic the medic informed that ip was seen by nightshift medic in relation to a pre-existing issue that the ip was taking regular analgesia for. hse focal point gave instruction for slfp/mech ocs to go and discuss with medic.  on morning of 11/07 hse fp informed of medevac of ip – no further action taken due to non-work related nature.as ip had already been medevac’d, there was no opportunity to obtain a statement at the time of being informed, however, it may be work related.  amec onshore hse interviewed ip 12/07/16.  ip reviewed by international sos- feedback form states illness not injury.mr peterson has been deemed fit to work onshore on office based duties. he has also been advised to follow up with his gp. (note:the comment in regards to fitness to work – is something that is always commented on when a report is provided. it provides an indication of the severity or otherwise of the reason for medevac) ip was reviewed by the medic.

laborer receive a glancing impact to his upper back by unsecured aluminum section of hydrovacuum tube. on 07-22-20 @1030 at the 5th and broadway project, during overcast conditions, while conducting hydro vacuum operations on storm drains, a laborer stepped within a hazard area to set a filter bag over a storm drain after hydro vacuum services had evacuated the drain. the hydrovac operator was in the process of stowing his equipment after completing the task by disengaging the six foot aluminum tube extension of the trunk vacuum line. after releasing the clamp on the line the equipment operator allowed the tube to stand upright uncontrolled after the disengagement. the operator turned to set the trunk into the cradle as the tube tipped, and in a glancing fashion, contacted the laborers upper back. the laborer notified the supervisor notifying him of the incident that occurred. the event was relayed to the safety representative whom made further notifications to management staff. a evaluation was conducted of the site and conditions with documentation. professional medical evaluation via occucare was conducted whereas the medical practitioner requested diagnostic imaging to rule out underlying conditions from the contact of the tube to the laborer.  local predesignated occupational medical facilities were contacted for further evaluation. the practitioners physical evaluation and imaging confirmed a simple contusion, non-complicated and treated with ice-pack and therapeutic rub. the laborer was released to return to work without restrictions. notifications were made, pertinent document conducted, employee evaluation and applicable first aid to employee.

category: lifting or moving loads, line strike
text: 12 inch water line was punctured by the excavator bucket.  during excavation operations on the north east corner of pdx-92 an excavator operator came in contact with a 12-inch live water line rupturing the pipe, allowing water to escape. the work was immediate stopped and the water was shut down. investigation ongoing. no further damage occurred. the line was repaired by wood and returned to service in less than 8 hours.  the water line isolated. the barricaded area was extended. wood executed at potholing method to locate the exact location of the water line. we excavated around the water line to expose the damage line. wood removed the damage water line and replaced with new. ongoing cholerization will take place for an estimated 72 hours. wood level one incident investigation commenced.

a wood employee tested positive for covid-19.  a wood employee tested positive for covid 19 after developing mild symptoms aboard gc-468 on the second day of the hitch. ee was sent in for home quarantine. contact tracing and facility sanitation is complete.  ee was sent in for quarantine. facility sanitation was complete and crew will isolate for 14 days with no outbound personnel allowed.

spider excavator identified leaking coolant from a hose due to a loose hose clamp spider excavator identified leaking coolant from a hose due to a loose hose clamp. leak to soil estimated at 50ml. machine had started to overheat due to low coolant level.  the overheating had caused the loose hose clamp.  low coolant level due to a mistake when checking fluids during pre-use checks (window washing fluid reservoir mistaken for coolant reservoir) leak contained with contaminated material removed for disposal. mechanic had checked the machine over and identified a damaged water pump (possibly due to the low coolant and overheating).  this has been replaced and now in working order.  spider excavator now in operable condition.  tuition provided to the spider excavator operator in relation to what system checks need to be made and where these systems are located.

category: covid, general illness or health issue
text: 1 confirmed covid-19 case on mariner a at approx. 01:00am on the 5th june ip (wood employee) contacted the platform medic and explained that he was feeling unwell.  the medic performed a rapid (antigen) covid-19 test which came back positive. the platform leadership team initiated wr2697 isolation and response plans, team and medic worked remotely with ip to prepare a close contact list which came to 10 personnel.  all identified personnel were provided a room for isolation.the medic started the process of testing all cat b close contacts, shortly into that process one of the close contacts (another wood employee) initially tested positive offshore.  3 subsequent tests conducted onshore (2 lateral flow and 1 nhs pcr) came back negative.all subsequent cat b close contacts came back with a negative result. transport arrangements and accommodation arranged for all personnel who returned onshore due to the situation.

category: covid, general illness or health issue
text: arkema(5) staff tested covid positive informed by arkema staff that was tested positive with minor sore throat. arkema staff will be quarantined at home and moh will guide further. disinfection will be carry out into the affected area. covid positive cases reported to statutory body.

a wood employee was in monitoring pre-embark to fpso peregrino, performed the covid-19 test and the result was positive a wood employee was in monitoring pre-embark to fpso peregrino, performed the covid-19 test and the result was positive. the ip is symptomatic. the employee is feeling symptoms such as loss of taste and smell. the ip received guidance from the nursing technician regarding the necessary care and will be sent to home for quarantine period

a security guard suffered a mini stroke inside cabin 2 this morning around 07.30 it was reported that churchill’s security guard seemed confused, had trouble speaking or understanding anything that was being said to him.graeme huggitt (trant’s first aider) acted swiftly by putting the ip into the recovery position inside cabin 2. we rang 999 to explain the situation, the first response ambulance came within 10 minutes and took the ip to hospital.after a few hours in hospital we discovered he had suffered a mini stroke (tia) but was able to return home.he is scheduled to see a  stroke specialist on monday morning.

the ip's right index finger was pinched between a pipe brace and the structure. whilst moving a pipe brace in order to remove a purlin the pipe brace moved and pinched the ip's right index finger. *first aid was administered.*the incident will be briefed at the following toolbox talk.

3rd party damaged wood fleet vehicle while loading it onto car hauler. wood fleet vehicle (ford f250 vin# 1ft7w2bt8kee91309,  lic# a038591) sustained damage to the top of the truck cab by the 3rd party driver while loading multiple trucks onto the car hauler.  damage was noticed by wood employee working in the yard.  actual severity selected as a1 as there was no injuries as a result of the event and damage is estimated to be less than $10,000.  a1 selected as potential severity as it is unlikely that injury could have resulted due to employee's location in relation to where the damage took place.  it is not feasible that damage is excess of $10,000 could have resulted. work was stopped, photos taken and incident reported for documentation.

cable tray damaged by truck at around 8:45 am a metallic structure was brought inside the coker plant, on a felbermayr platform trailer, to be erected on the existing structure on the coker drums.the trailer went inside the plant guided by a spotter moving forward next to the main control room. the spotter was positioned to make sure the right side was secured to not go near the scaffolding structure near that area. while making the unloading maneuvers, the metallic structure touched the cable tray between the trailer and the main control room. no damaged to the electrical cables. no injured persons. the truck has been immediately stopped.afw informed the chief of the plant of the event. spoting (project electrical contractor) fixed temporary the cable tray.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: while a team leader was going up the stairs from the ground floor to the first floor of the office, he fell down and hurted his hand's thumb while a team leader was going up the stairs from the ground floor to the first floor of the office, he fell down and twisted his hand's thumb.  the ip went to the clinic for x-ray and no fractures have been identified.

employee has been tested covid-19 positive employee has been tested covid-19 positive the employee has been working from home since march 2020. employee had symptoms of covid-19 and went for testing. the employee was found to be positive. employee has been tested covid-19 positive the employee has been working from home since march 2020. employee had symptoms of covid-19 and went for testing. the employee was found to be positive. the employee has been on home quarantine as per medical advise.

while removing a hydrant post with a mini backhoe the post tiped and smashed through the bottom window of the machine.  while removing a hydrant post with a mini backhoe the post tiped and smashed through the bottom window of the machine.  work was stopped. area cleaned. updated jsa to reflect.

category: general injury, hand or arm injury
text: caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  on december 17, 2015, at approximately 9:00 am, an employee was empting a bag of recyclable material into a grinding machine when the bag became lodged into the equipment. the employee tried to free the bag from the equipment and he was pulled into the equipment. the employee suffered broken bones and damage to his skin on the right wrist and left arm.

category: general injury, fall from or working at height issue, slips & trips
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee was climbing a ladder built into a fertilizer tank trailer to access the lid and fill the tank when the employee slipped and fell from the ladder to the ground, landing on and breaking the right hip. the employee was hospitalized.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation on august 5, 2016, at 1:15 pm, an employee's finger was caught in the pinch point of a press brake, amputating his left ring fingertip.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was attempting to replace a belt on the pulley system in the bagging area. the machine was stopped when the employee pulled on the pulley. due to high tension on the belt, the employee's right hand was pulled between the belt and pulley resulting in amputation of the first two fingertips on the right hand.

part of occupantís body caught between vehicle and other object in nonroadway transport incident an employee was operating a stand-up truck. the employee's hand was smashed between the truck and a storage rack.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: fall, slip, trip, unspecified  an employee was walking across stored rebar on the ground to access some framework angle iron. he retrieved a piece of angle iron and was returning back across the rebar, when he slipped and fell. the band of rebar that was being carried in his right hand came down on his left ring finger causing an open fracture which required surgery.

caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified an employee was shutting down a piece of equipment when his fingertip got caught in a pulley.  the employee received a partial amputation of the right middle finger.

struck by or caught in swinging door or gate an employee working in a meat cooler opened the cooler door to exit when his finger was caught between the door handle and the wall on the cooler. the employee's middle finger on his left hand was amputated.
caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified an employee was using a clamp when the clamp closed on his finger resulting in a partial amputation of the left index fingertip.

fall on same level, unspecified on september 29, 2016, an employee was playing baseball with clients when he suffered a torn patellar tendon avulsion in his right knee, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

struck by dislodged flying object, particle an employee was attempting to lift a metal grate off of a burn table for cleaning purposes. using a two-hook chain sling, the employee used one of the hooks with the other being left to dangle. the other hook got caught under the frame of the burn table. when the employee went to lift the grate, the hook that was unknowingly caught came free, flying across and striking the employee in the face. the employee suffered contusions to the face, nose, left cheek, and right forehead.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was clearing a jam in front of the wood sorter gate before the chipper in-feed conveyor. the jammed wood had pushed the sorter gate up to nearly the full-open position. the employee attached a chain-fall to one of the jammed logs. as the log was raised, the rest of the jam was relieved and fell on the conveyor below. the sorter gate then closed on the employee's right leg crushing it between the gate, a piece of wood and the surrounding frame. the employee's lower right leg was fractured.

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips

pedestrian struck by vehicle on side of road, unspecified while marking gas lines at the side of a road, an employee was struck by a vehicle. the employee suffered broken bones and was hospitalized.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was manually feeding bags into a machine when his left index finger was caught and partially amputated between the machine's belt and sprocket.

category: hand or arm injury, vehicle incident general, slips & trips
text: struck by other falling powered vehicle an employee was replacing a tie bolt on a vehicle's leaf spring when the vehicle slipped off the portable hydraulic jack and landed on the employee's left hand. his left hand was crushed, and the bolt pierced his left pinky finger, which required surgical amputation.
struck by dislodged flying object, particle an employee was punching holes in a quarter-inch angle iron when the die broke and shattered. a chip of the die impaled the employee's chest.

category: dropped object or material, lifting or moving loads, hand or arm injury, vehicle incident general
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was flipping a grate on a manual grinding line. as he was placing the grate on the table to lay it down, the grate came off the hook, fell, and crushed the employee's right hand.

category: hand or arm injury, fall from or working at height issue, head or face injury
text: other fall to lower level 16 to 20 feet an employee was preparing for a concrete pour from the platform of a scaffolding system. the employee stepped on the platform and fell approximately 17.5 feet to the ground along with a scaffold plank. the employee sustained a fractured left wrist, a sprained right wrist, and facial lacerations and was hospitalized.

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was using a torque gun to loosen a bonnet bolt on a blowout preventer door. the torque gun swung around and struck his left middle finger, causing the amputation of half of the finger.

category: general injury, fall from or working at height issue, slips & trips
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee was tying down a load on a flatbed trailer with binding straps. as he threw a strap across the load, he released the strap and lost balance. he fell to the ground, striking and fracturing his left hip.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee's right index finger was amputated while greasing the conveyor that feeds the boiler. he had bent down to pick up his radio when his right hand got caught in the chain.

exposure through intact skin, eyes, or other exposed tissue an employee heard a loud noise coming from the pool pumps. during the employee's investigation of the noise, the pump exploded and trichloroisocyanuric acid splashed onto the employee's face, neck, and chest causing chemical burns.

category: lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general, head or face injury, dropped object or material, slips & trips
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was loading a steel cylinder cradle onto a forklift when the cradle slipped off the forks and hit the back of his head and other parts of his body. he suffered a fractured skull.
hitting, kicking, beating, shoving an employee was assaulted and robbed in a parking lot, suffering a concussion.
struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee was using a table saw to cut wood pieces when the blade amputated a portion of his right ring finger.

struck by rolling object or equipment being pushed by another  person an employee was transporting 50,000 lbs. of materials on a cart. the injured employee was standing nearby and the cart ran over their left foot resulting in five broken toes and abrasions.
exposure to environmental heat while observing work outside, an employee suffered from heat exhaustion.

struck by or caught in swinging door or gate an employee was leaving a breakroom. while she was holding the door open for another employee, the door slammed on her right little finger. the employee sustained a partial amputation to the finger.

category: dropped object or material, foot or leg injury
text: struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee was pulling metal pipes from a bundle of six. he was breaking the metal bands that were holding the bundle together to retrieve two of the six. as he was cutting the final band, two of the metal pipes fell from the bundle and struck his right leg, breaking it.

contact with objects and equipment, unspecified an employee was helping a driver unchain a load on a haul trailer. the load weighed approximately 20,000 to 30,000 pounds. the trailer was lowered onto the employee's feet fracturing the employee's toes.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was being trained to operate a saw machine. the employee was guiding pieces of wood from the chain deck conveyor into the saw. the employee's fingertip got caught between the wood being pushed and the chain conveyor's guard. when the employee felt his fingertip get pinched he pulled his hand out. his left pinky fingertip was fractured and a portion of the fingertip was pulled off.

contact with hot objects or substances an employee was retrieving a pan of chili meat and hot water that had been cooking inside the microwave. the pan slipped out of her hands and hot chili spilled over her left arm and hand. she sustained first and second degree burns.

category: foot or leg injury, back injury, general injury
text: compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was working inside an 8' x 26' steel trench box and was helping an excavator operator install a 30" ductile iron pipe. he directed the track excavator operator to place a bucket of stone bedding for the next pipe to be installed. the excavator operator dumped the bucket of stone into the trench and began to level the stone. the employee was then caught between the excavator bucket and the bell of the pipe, suffering a fractured left leg, fractured ribs, a fractured pelvis, and punctured lungs. he was hospitalized and had surgery.
